flawed_nl_solution:
The additional yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 x 40/100 = <<40*40/100=16>>16 yards.
So the total yard he will be able to run to after improving his speed is 40 + 16 = <<40+16=65>>65 yards in 5 seconds.
Therefore the total yards he will be able to run to within 10 seconds is 65 x 2 = <<65*2=130>>130.
#### 130

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 56, not 65. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
